title: Advanced Micro Devices
text:
Advanced Micro Devices
Advanced Micro Devices, short AMD, is possibly an undervalued silicon architecture IP player in the AI race.

title: Advanced Micro Devices
text:
Earnings from 4th Feb 2025:
On the day after the earnings, the stock has been around 110 USD. Compared to 2023, the Q4 2024 improved the margin from 51% to 54% (Non-GAAP). Revenue rose 24% while NVIDIA rose over 100%. FY Revenue was 25.8B for AMD and a Non-GAAP FY2024 operating Income of 6.1B. While net profit is lower, this stock possibly deserves a market cap of at least 150B (with 107 USD share price, the valuation is at 174B USD). This stock is fairly valued and positioned at the biggest growth sectors for the next 5 Years.

title: Rockwell Automation
text:
Rockwell Automation- a global leader in industrial automation and digital transformation
Headquarted in Milwaukee, Wisconson, this company makes the world more productive.
A purely financial return perspective:
Rockwell had a revenue of 9B in 2023 and grows very cyclically. I estimate the 5-y profit around 1B and based on its Price-to of 4.81 (EPS forecast of 8.32) and should deserve a PE around 15-20. The market cap is at 29B making it too expensive (appropriate shareprice: 16*8.32 USD= 133 USD.

Stocks charts within a tab


Chart since inceptionChart of the last year




















A premium valuation:
Rockwell is valuated with a premium US-valuation.


Earnings informations/comments:

title: Bruker
text:
Bruker Corp
Bruker is a research and scientific company that groups their earnings into BSI BioSpin, BSI CALID and BSI Nano segments. It commints itself to spend 10% of their revenue into R&D. Their main customers are Academic&goverments, Industrial & Greentech, Biopharma, Microbiology, Semi-Metrology and Applied/Food. In my opinion, they are clearly a market leading in NMR and EPR spectroscopy, Preclinical imaging, Biotypers, NIR, X-ray and Atomic Force Microscopy (AFM).
A purely financial return perspective:
From September 2014 to September 2024, this stock managed to return 14% p.a. (278% over 10y). The SP500 returned 7.7% or 111% over the same period. The dividend for BRKR is very minimal and only 0.05 per quarter (0.20 USD for 2024). Its close peer ThermoFisher Scientific managed to return 417% over the same period (btw as a comparison the high flyer GOOGL returned 445%). However, Thermo followed a more aggressive financial M&A strategy that definetly paid of during a time a low interest rates. I believe that from 2024-2034 Bruker might have a better return since its internal structure are more organized.

title: Bruker
text:
Earnings from 06.08.2024 Q2 2024:
The quarter Q2 2024 showed strong organic and CER revenue growth. Revenue increased to 800M from 682 M (17.4%). Full Year EPS should be around 2.80 USD and based on FY growth the stock should deserve a PE of 20. Fair price should be only around 56 USD whereas the stock trades at around 60 USD.

title: McDonalds is a fast food giant and a real estate monster
text:
McDondalds- the real estate giant
Earnings comments:
Q2-2024: According to the Release (https:Hyperlink to Q2 Earnings), Q2-2024 had this headline:
-Consolidated revenues for the quarter were nearly $6.5 billion, an increase over prior year of about 1% in constant currencies
-Systemwide sales* to loyalty members across 50 loyalty markets were over $26 billion for the trailing twelve-month period and approximately $7 billion for the quarter
-Diluted earnings per share was $2.80, a decrease of 11% (10% in constant currencies). Excluding the current year charges described above of $0.17 per share, diluted earnings per share was $2.97, a decrease of 6% (5% in constant currencies) when also excluding prior year charges.**
This sounds very disappointing, but shares are trading 2% percent higher in the pre-market. Apparently, MCD tries to lure back consumers for higher dinner discounts.
My thoughts: MCD will struggle a few more quarters before they are on a growing path again. I will try to buy the stock at lower levels around 220USD. Long-term no brainer? I am not sure anymore. I am pretty confident that MCD will always exits and make its profits, however GLP1-drugs (obesity drugs) might actually be big road-blocker. That might block growth until 2030 and rather earlier then later.

Stocks charts within a tab


Chart since inceptionChart of the last year

title: Veeva
text:
Autodesk
C Veeva Systems Inc. is a cloud-computing company that focuses on providing software solutions for the pharmaceutical and life sciences industry. Here are some key points about Veeva:
Founding and Headquarters:
Founded in 2007 by Peter Gassner and Matt Wallach. Headquartered in Pleasanton, California, United States
Industry Focus:
Veeva specializes in developing cloud-based software tailored for the life sciences sector. Their solutions address the unique challenges faced by companies in this industry
Market Capitalization:
As of May 2023, the market cap is around 30Bi while having a revenue guidance of 2.4B for 2024.

Stocks charts within a tab


Chart since inceptionChart of the last year




















#My bullcase for the stock
Veeva managed to grew revenue by 24% y/y. Compared to Salesforce, which is around 9% growth, this is high growth business. Obviously, the stock deserves a premium. And it has it. Which a EBITA around 0.4B, the stock has a P/E multiple around 55 (EPS of 3.48 to 194 USD shareprice).
With the current AI boom, pharma companies might go into the trial phase way faster. Then, they are in need of Veeva as a CRM. They might be the next boom for this company.

title: Honeywell
text:
Honeywell
Honeywell International is headquarted in Charlotte, North Corlina and operates in the aerospace, automation, performance materials and technologies businesses.

Stocks charts within a tab


Chart since inceptionChart of the last year






















JP Morgan Industrials Conferences:
This chart is their main message: A long-term EPS growth of 8-12%. And this is what I like. A average growing business giving me a return of at least 8%. That means you can double your money here every 10 years most likely. On top you get a 2% Dividend yield. Institutional investors will hold this stock and for me as a private investor, this gives me a sleep well at night feeling while doubling down every 10y.



Long-termin financial growth algorithm




FY 2024 outlook:
Earnings Q1 2024: 
Do they keep what they promise? Well, in 1Q 2024 they actually beat their guidance of 2.12-2.22$ by 0.03$. Great start! Organic sales growth is roughly 3%. More interestingly, in FY guidance, they promise up to 6B in Free cash flow (13% growth). This is solid and a nice growth. They definetly justify their higher PE around 20. I am a buyer here and I will make it roughly 3% of my whole portfolio!

title: Nike Clothing
text:
Nike Inc
“At Nike, our passion for sport, innovation, and authenticity drives us. It fuels us through challenges and inspires us to emerge even stronger. In fiscal 2023, that passion fed our successes and helped to power transformations in support of future growth—both in the business and with respect to corporate governance.” - Message from the Executive Chairman

Stocks charts within a tab


Chart since inceptionChart of the last year






















Earnings informations/comments:
Earnings from 21.12.2024 (Q2 2025):
Earnings from 01.10.2024 (Q1 2025):
The numbers were pretty disappointing. During the quarter Nike Direct Sales were down 13% while digital sales were down 15%. Net income Q/Q went to by -28% to roughly 1B. I do not think its about the numbers today. This quarter was meant to get all bad numbers out before the new CEO Elliot comes in on 14.10.2024. Also Chinese stimulus should be very beneficial to Nike sales in the upcoming quarters.


Annual Meeting information:
Check this out: Directors are getting 50k-300k paid in cash, stock awards, or other compensation:



Director Compensation 2023


Nike has been growing Sales by a lot. The revenue of 2015 was 30 billion, in 2023 its roughly 50 billion marking nearly the double. Same for the Gross profit. The operating income just increased by roughly 20% though (4 billion to 5 billion) over the last 8 years.



Income statements 2015-2023


Let’s also take a look at some financials ratios. Historically the PE of Nike has always been around 20-30. Interestingly, the Price-to-Sales (PS) was 2.56 in 2017 and in roughly 3.19 in 2023. To get a fair stock price, it should get down to 2.80 roughly.



Financial ratios 2015-2023

Abbott Laboratories
Abbott Laboratories is an American multinational medical devices and health care company with headquarters in Abbott Park, Illinois, United States. It split off its research-based pharmaceuticals business into AbbVie in 2013.

title: Meta stock analysis
text:
Earnings from 31.07.2024
Incredible! Revenue is up by 22% while costs and expenses are only 7%. This results in diluted earnings per share to 5.16 for Q2 2024, so FY EPS should be at least 20 USD. Given that growth of over 20%, this stock deserves a multiple of at least 30 (plus they overspend on CAPEX). Easy calculation: 20 USD * 30 = 600 USD stock price. Right now we see a stock price of roughly 530 USD. There is some room until the rest of the year.
Here the chart picture in the given timeframe:

title: The market after the election
text:
November 2024
Donald Trump won. And obviously the result will heavily disappointed a lot of people not only in the US, but also in the whole world. He stands for disruption….clearly something the citizen was looking for. Anyway, the market liked it. The days after the results, the SP500 gained and the technical bullish chart is intact.



Candle chart as of 25 November 2024


On top of that, Trump continues to signal a pro-business environment such as a less-regulatory burden for Full-Self-Driving cars (Musk, Tesla).
Nonetheless, everything Trump wants to implement is highly inflationary. And that might be exactly the mechanism that ruins Trump’s image. Obviously, everyone hates inflation. Despite higher wages, it just makes you feel weaker independent of your income situation.

What might happen in the next 5 years with Trump as a president:

sentiment towards Trump will gradually decrease and swing towards a negative picture. The end of 2024 might be the highest popularity Trump will ever see and most likely never see again. Inflation will spike in 2025 and 2026.
Europe will face huge problems, not only the on the Ukraine front, but also economically. The EU needs China, but also needs USA. It will stay caught up in the middle. Strong political leadership might be able to find good deals in negotiations. Still a waking-up punch that EU policies need.
EV and FSD transition continues and will speed up.
Big Tech will continue to compound nicely.

title: 2024 September cutting cycle begins
text:
September 2024
Update 26.09.2024:
The market slowly continues to slowly go higher. The Swiss central bank SNB also cuts by 25 bps.
Update 19.09.2024: The FED cuts by 50 BP. Rates will be at 4.75% to 5.00% soon. The ECB already cutted in EU zone interest rate to 3.50% last week.
Initially, the stock market had barely reactions were pretty insignificant. However, the market the day after opened by the biggest up-gap since 2008. Interestingly, in that very scenario the market turned first up but then later down and only recovered in late-2009 with its bottom in Feb 2009. In the 2024 scenario, the FED tried to get ahead of anything. The economy looks robust and basically only the low-income consumers suffers.




FED rates; in grey recessions 19.09.2024



Statistically, the stock market has a bad second half of September. So far not true for this year. Additionally in election years, the October has bad returns.
But I have some other question that came to my mind:

Why the dollar does not drop in a rate-cutting cycle; why the dollar is strengthening?
Why does the 10y-bond yield even increase today?


What I think right now:

Cash is trash —> we need to buy equities (but everyone knows that as well)
Biontech companies should profit since risk-assets become more attractive
Investors will continue to chase yield like REITs
Industrial stocks have tons of OPEX and CAPEX —> lowering borrowing costs should help these equities nicely
regional banks should have a comeback (this one I am not interested in)
companies are planing their budget for 2025 right now —> the 50bp cut comes with perfect timing


What might happen:

the initial strong up-move might be followed by tons of sentiment traders
however a drop is always near; we are cutting because of weak signs (remember!)
I will try to get into specific stocks with reasonable evaluation

title: Market predictions for 2025
text:
Trends for 2025

AI: AI Software stocks will be able to sell their software nicely. Big tech already started that in 2024.
Seminconductors: Some stocks will continue to perform nicely, but the broader semiconductor market might not. Hard to stockpick here.
Healthcare: I think Healtcare will have a comeback in 2025
US REITS: Those REITs like REXR, VICI, etc. have a low valuation and possibly they deliver 20% in 2025.
Chemistry: Possibly Chemistry companies hit rock-botton in 2024 and they are set for a strong comeback in 2025.



Top performers for 2025

NVIDIA: I continue to believe that NVIDIA will deliver in 2025, but it will not double in share price. My price target for 2025: 200 USD and then the RSI might fall.
Merck: Pharma will develop a strong pipeline and defensive stocks will perform nicely when growth fears start.
Rexford Realty: Industrial REIT based in California. Defensive play while the FED lowers interest rates.
Samsung: Cheap valuation caused by political problems in Korea. This stock might come back strongly with AI features and a strong semiconductors upswing.
Adobe: AI software play. Adobe only grows 10% which is too few, but possibly their growth accelerates again in 2025.

title: Market predictions for 2024
text:
Trends for 2024
1. AI: Obviously computational intelligence will drive the next year. It’s hype will most likely peak in 2024 Semester 1. There will be tons of overrated companies selling or marketing the idea of AI. The question is which companies will last. For sure Microsoft, Alphabet, Tesla, Facebook, etc. will be a vital role in implementing ideas. But there will be plenty of small sized companies trying to raise money and funding by selling the idea of AI. But my prediction is that only 5% of those smaller capped companies will actually make a profitable business concept with this.
2. Air traffic: The tourism recovery after the covid pandemic stopp will slowly recover and maybe outgrow the volume of 2019.
3. The richer are getting richer: 2024 might also be the year where middle class living costs are peaking. The middle class in USA and EU suffered enough the last years. They might not longer accept that a person with a 100k income pays more taxes (independent of USA vs Europe) on its income than the multi-millionaire.
4. Luxury market: The premium product market might continue to outperform other sectors again. And this is directly connected to trend number 3. The rich still have plenty of disposible wealth. And since you can not be happiness, they might be as well a new “Channel” handbag.
5. Phone and media addiction: Kids nowadays grow up with a phone and by the age of 16, they already have a Instragram, Snapchat, Tiktok and whatever account. On those platfarms, most people (not only kids for sure) are spending more than 3h per day. 3h per idea is nearly 25% of our active daytime (lets say 16h awake time). Phones and media decreased our attention spane by a lot. I notice this on myself as well of course. But thank god AI is componesating our less efficient work equally, if not even better. But investor-vise, this might be quite obvious. So much of our attention goes to media and this is how humans spend accordingly. Back the days, the typical dad bought his cars based on TV advertisements, now its what is shown between Instagram reels.


Top performers for 2024
1. Alphabet: Google launched Gemini. And this is only the start. There is beautiful ideas of implementing it in science. The executives will announced the news according to the stock price.
2. LVHM: Like previously said, the rich have disposible income to spend on. LVHM and Hermes are the go-to products
3. Novo Nordisk: This company has already Ozempic (GLP1 inhibitor) on the market. But that is not it. They might bring the same product on the market as a pill. This might boost the profit even more.
4. Walt Disney: The media giant might be a turn-around in 2024. Every giant needs to go down before going up (look at Intel in 2023). I believe Walt disney has unique selling point and brand. They kind of lost the battle with Netflix, but there theme markets will stay unbeatable.
5. Alibaba: Never forget China! Alibaba is making a decent continous quarterly profit and is even willing to pay a small dividend. That is what Western investor appreciate! Another candidate for a nice turn around!
#Update 02.01.2025:
Performance Review: Alphabet made 35%, LVHM -17%, Novo Nordisk -16%, Walt Disney made 23%, Alibaba made 14%. In a equalized portfolio with each stock holding 20%, this portfolio would have made 7.8% and clearly underperforming the market (SP500 made 25%).

title: About
text:
This is my little side project in order to learn some more coding. I also like to write down some thoughts here that I am going to review in the past.
This website is created with Quarto, which is a great tool to make data public as well as combing R, Python and html code (Learn more about Quarto here.)
Its me newest passion to follow financials news, watch Bloomberg and trying to understand the psychology of financial markets. After years, I figured out how portfolio managers are managing. Since I am a retail investor, I figured partly out when to shine and when to be greedy. In simple terms: “Be greedy when there is blood on the streets”. But this is easier said then done. I am pretty much already happy, when I make 60% of my choice correct.
Here a photo from a sunrise from the financial hub of the world:



Sunrise NY on 04.09.2024

title: My dividend income
text:
Introduction
This site gives a brief overview about my dividend income and it’s values are updated automatically via scripting. The Plot the data represents the amount of received dividends of the last year.

title: My dividend income
text:
Market Events and Performance
The performance of the S&P 500 is subject to various market events, including economic data releases, corporate earnings reports, geopolitical developments, and central bank decisions. Market fluctuations in the S&P 500 can have a cascading effect on other financial markets and impact investor confidence.

title: My dividend income
text:
Long term predictions
For this point, I want to demonstrate two scenarios:
-1. scenario: 200k start, weak performance and an average growth of 5% while adding 10k per year (2% starting dividend yield), taxed with 26% without DRIP:



5 % growth


In this scenario 1, the portfolio will be worth roughly over 1M with a dividend income of 22k after 25 years.
-2. scenario: 200k start, weak performance and an average growth of 10% while adding 10k per year (2% starting dividend yield), taxed with 26% without DRIP:



10% growth


In this scenario 2, the portfolio will be worth roughly over 2.5M with a dividend income of 50k after 25 years.

title: The SP500
text:
Conclusion
In summary, the S&P 500 is a crucial index that provides insight into the performance of the U.S. stock market and, by extension, the broader economy. Its composition, calculation methodology, and historical significance make it an essential tool for investors and analysts alike.
For up-to-date information on the S&P 500, please refer to reputable financial news sources and market data providers.

title: Big teach earnings Q1 2024
text:
Big tech never stops making money? Q1 2024 Earnings thoughts
Last week Google, Meta and Tesla reported their earnings followed by Amazon and Apple this week. Let’s first check out their stock prices since January 2023:

Stocks charts within a tab


Chart since inceptionChart of the last year
















: Prediction Amazon Earnings Mar2024




Chart wise the picture is obvious. Meta Platforms had a great run trippling their price while Amazon roughly doubled. Apple and tesla barely had any stock chart improvements. Especially Tesla used to run way higher and its downfall might be well dramatized. FSD might come up within the next 2 years as predicted from the Youtube channel “electric viking”. Apple was reported to use Microsofts OpenAI for its product (which I doubt since they are prone to have the best vertical integration of AI upon everyone).
Now lets check what is predicted for Amazon and Apple this week.

title: 2024 September
text:
September 2024
Historically, the September is not a good month in terms of stock returns. That means: perfect time to buy:




QQQ Trading view screenshot from 03.09.2024



The 03rd of September was already a strong sell-off. However, I do not think 2024 will end the bull market for technology stocks. Instead I consider it a strong buy the dip opportunity.

Same for the broader SP500. They pullback of the beginning of September might be very much a short buying window. Big tech earnings in October will bring in positiv sentiment. My target 6000 by Q1 2025.



SP 500 ETF aus of 04.09.2024

title: UK’s Labour government raises taxes by £40 billion in new budget plan
text:
Oktober 2024
Update 30.10.2024:
The UK unveiled their budget and will include 40 billion pounds worth of tax rises.
The independent Office for Budget Responsibility will release updated U.K. GDP growth forecasts of 1.1% for 2024 and 2% in 2025, Reeves said.

What might happen:

more billionaires will leave the UK for more tax-friendly countries (from Frankfurt to Dubai)
UK will appear less of a business-friendly country (since a hike in the amount of employers pay out in National Insurance (NI))

title: Tesla stock analysis
text: Tesla

title: Tesla stock analysis
text:
Earnings from 23.07.2024 (Q2-2024):
Total automotive revenue dropped -7%, whereas energy generation and storage revenue is up by 100%, service revenue is up 21%, operating margin is only at 6.3% (-333bp), thus Tesla at this point is mainly good profitable car manufacturer.

title: Tesla stock analysis
text:
Thoughts from 22.08.2024:
Tesla is a great company, but it does not deserve this multiple. Its CEO Elon Musk is totally going mental and he is more like holywood figure than a good CEO. He focuses more and getting the 15th child with the 15th woman instead of giving the right timelines for the Robotaxi. I think the robotaxi event in October 2024 might not fulfil its promises. For years the Tesla stock gave extraordinary ROIs, however the patience is pretty stretched since 2020. It might be time for a sell of and Tesla might return to a normal valuation. The net profit for 2024 might be only 10 B. Given a multiple of 25, this stock only deserve a valuation of 250 B (currently roughly 700B). Clearly a dangerous situation to be in as an investor. The Tesla Management got to keep its promises regarding energy transition and Full-self driving.
Here the chart:

title: Google stock analysis
text: Google stock

title: Google stock analysis
text:
Earnings from 29.10.2024:
Shares are up 5% in extended trading due to a strong beat in expectations. The search giant reported earnings per share of $2.12 on revenue of $88.27 billion for the quarter ended Sept. 30. That represents a profit and sales increase from the same period last year of 37% and 15%, respectively. In short, GenAi did not hurt Alphabets business at all.

title: Google stock analysis
text:
Earnings from 23.07.2024:
Revenue of 84.74B and Net income of 23.62B. That sounds like an awesome Net profit margin of nearly 28%. They will end up with over >110B Net Income most likely. Based on their earnings growth, they deserve a multiple of at least 20 P/E. That makes a market cap of 2.2T + 100B cash they have laying around in their Balance sheet (in total 2.3 trillion then). As of 04.09.2024, their market cap is around 2T making it a fair buy already as of today. I will continue to add here and I am expection in to maybe hit 3T already next year. They have nice AI opportunities in Self-driving cars and Life science as well as their core business of advertisment. Youtube is a totally underrated platform (its basically Netflix or Youtube as entertainment for me).
From a technical chart perspective, I am trying to add around the 5th of August lows at 154 USD:

title: Google stock analysis
text:
Technical Chart analysis from 18.09.2024:
Alphabet won an EU antitrust process (over 1.5BN) this morning. From a technical point of view, this might be a good entry point for a trade. Taking profit could be around 200 USD in mid 2026 (30% upside):



Technical Chart analysis from 18.09.2024

title: Samsung Stock analysis
text:
Samsung stock
Samsung makes the good phones. But not only that, they are involved basically everywhere.
Officially they devide their businesses into:
1: DX division: Televisions, monitors, airconditioners, laundry machines etc. (roughly 65%)
2: DS division: DRAM, NANDflash, etc. (30%)
3: SDC: smartphones
4: Haman: digital cockpits
5: Others:
Personally, I like the stock a lot. It gives great exposure into Asian capital markets and I consider the stock a infrastructure play into AI, semiconductors and electronics.

title: Autodesk
text:
Autodesk
Autodesk, Inc. is an American multinational software corporation that provides software products and services for the architecture, engineering, construction, manufacturing, media, education, and entertainment industries. Autodesk is headquartered in San Francisco, California,[2] and has offices worldwide. Its U.S. offices are located in the states of California, Oregon, Colorado, Texas, Michigan, New Hampshire and Massachusetts. Its Canada offices are located in the provinces of Ontario, Quebec, and Alberta.

Stocks charts within a tab


Chart since inceptionChart of the last year






















Key take aways for me:

Gross profit return: Autodesk managed to increase the gross profit from 1.5B to 5B over 15 years representing a 8% return per annum:




Gross profit of Autodesk since 2009



AI play: I think software like CAD will be able to implement AI tools very early on. This might make engineers and architects more productive and cost-efficient. The customer will pay for it.

I bought this at around 197 Euros in May 2024.

title: Rexford Realty
text:
Rexford Industrial
This company has a very strong focus: Southern California! And I like that very much. Working for pretty global company in the past, I noticed that being super specific in a niche can be very beneficial! This REIT mainly has property in the high demand area of California which high barrier sub-markets and obviously a region that is fulfilled with emerging tech and industrial industries.

Stocks charts within a tab


Chart since inceptionChart of the last year




















#Overview about the company:
Here a screenshot from their past presentation:



Overview Investor presentation April 2024





5 year performance compared to peer group





Repositioning





Growth of SQM since IPO (nearly 10x)


What I find particularly interesting is the EPS growth. It goes from 0.36 to 1.12 USD in a 8 year time span:



Financials


#My bullcase for the stock
Rexford has a quite conservative leverage and balance sheet. It is comparable to those from Prologis or Stag Industrial with a DEBT to EBITA of roughly 2000% (3year average).Despite that, it managed to grow a little bit faster than other REITs. According to S&P, Fitch or Moody’s its Balance Sheet is in the BBB area. I do not necessary trust those Grades, but most likely they know better than me. Its growth should continue with more properties going to market. On top of that, REITs and especially industrial REITs are solar/energy companies now as well (REXR generating over 70k MWH annually). This should be another small tailwind in the upcoming AI energy transition phase.

title: NVIDIA
text:
NVIDIA
NVIDIA turns out to be the most discussed stock in 2024. They figured out how to turn GPUs with parallel processing into AI enalbers.

title: NVIDIA
text:
Earnings from 29.08.2024:
29.08.2024:
After-market moves led to -7% (116 USD roughly). Q2 revenue came in as 30B and Gross margin came down to 75% (from 78%).
28.08.2024: One of the most anticipated earnings of the year. Maybe the most important earnings of the last 5 years. It will show where AI will end up in a phase where people fear a soft landing or a recession. Last quarter, NVIDIA made 26B in revenue with a net income of nearly 15B. Growth is expected to slow that but the Street estimates 31-33B in revenue. Traders are positioned +/- 10% on the down or upsides. For most people its not smart to anticipate any earnings movement here. I personally will go into the earnings with earnings META. META might be the first beneficiary of AI and LLM. Zuckerberg has a great understanding of what AI can do in the short- and long term. My thoughts: There might not be such a strong movement as anticipated. Traders are already strongly positioned and willing to be the stock at lower levels. This signals to me that NOTHING will come with surprises on that Wednesday evening. Chances are more on the upside than downside and the market went down in advance (QQQ at 471.86 as of recording) opening door for a Thursday +3% rally.

title: BASF
text:
BASF- “Badische Anilin- und Sodafabrik”
BASF is a large chemistry producer headquartered in Ludwigshafen in the state of Baden-Würtenberg.
A purely financial return perspective:
BASF has been stagnating for the last 10 years. The stock chart nicely reflects the company’s financial accurately. For the last 20 years, the earnings by share fluctuated around -0,10 Cents to plus 2.00 Euros per share nicely reflecting a cyclical chemistry business. However, the share still return a net positive return with dividends and partially buybacks.

Stocks charts within a tab


Chart since inceptionChart of the last year




















New corporate strategy:
On 26.09.2024, BASF presented new ambitions. They want to return 12 billion to shareholders from 2025-2028 (a dividend of 2.25 Euros per share). BASF debt level might allow it, however it is still not poised for long-term growth. However, this move might make sense in its current interest rate cutting cycle.
A tactical hegde play:
Personally, I consider BASF as a more defense hedge play. The downside risk might be pretty low. It might return 2-3% in stock price return over the long-term and a high dividend on top. I will consider adding for low prices around 42 Euros which reflects a dividend yield of above 5%.
